declarations.description: The `drive-picker-docs-view` element is used to define a view for the Google Drive Picker.
declarations.name: DrivePickerDocsViewElement

members.name: view
members.description: Gets the Google Drive Picker view based on the current attribute values.

attributes.name: enable-drives
attributes.description: Whether to allow the user to select files from shared drives.

attributes.name: include-folders
attributes.description: Whether to include folders in the view.

attributes.name: mime-types
attributes.description: A comma-separated list of MIME types to filter the view.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode of the view.

attributes.name: owned-by-me
attributes.description: Whether to show files owned by the user.

attributes.name: parent
attributes.description: The ID of the folder to view.

attributes.name: query
attributes.description: The query string to filter the view.

attributes.name: select-folder-enabled
attributes.description: Whether to allow the user to select folders.

attributes.name: starred
attributes.description: Whether to show starred files.

attributes.name: view-id
attributes.description: The ID of the view.

declarations.description:
The `drive-picker` web component provides a convenient way to integrate the Google Picker API into your web applications. The Google Picker API is a JavaScript API that allows users to select or upload Google Drive files. This component acts as a "File Open" dialog for accessing and interacting with files stored on Google Drive.

Features:
- Provides a similar look-and-feel to the Google Drive UI.
- Offers several views showing previews and thumbnail images of Drive files.
- Displays as an inline, modal window, ensuring users never leave the main application.

Note: The Google Picker API does not support file organization, moving, or copying. For these operations, you should use either the Google Drive API or the Drive UI.
declarations.name: DrivePickerElement

slots.description: The default slot contains View elements to display in the picker. Each View element should implement a property `view` of type `google.picker.View`.

members.name: views
members.description: The `google.Picker.View` objects to display in the picker as defined by the slot elements.

events.description: Triggered when the user cancels the picker dialog.
events.name: cancel

events.description: Triggered when the user picks one or more items.
events.name: picked

events.description: Triggered when the picker is loaded.
events.name: loaded

attributes.name: app-id
attributes.description: The Google Drive app ID.

attributes.name: client-id
attributes.description: The OAuth 2.0 client ID.

attributes.name: developer-key
attributes.description: The API key for accessing Google Picker API.

attributes.name: hide-title-bar
attributes.description: Hides the title bar of the picker if set to true.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: The locale to use for the picker.

attributes.name: max-items
attributes.description: The maximum number of items that can be selected.

attributes.name: mine-only
attributes.description: If set to true, only shows files owned by the user.

attributes.name: multiselect
attributes.description: Enables multiple file selection if set to true.

attributes.name: nav-hidden
attributes.description: Hides the navigation pane if set to true.

attributes.name: oauth-token
attributes.description: The OAuth 2.0 token for authentication.

attributes.name: origin
attributes.description: The origin parameter for the picker.

attributes.name: relay-url
attributes.description: The relay URL for the picker.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: The OAuth 2.0 scope for the picker.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The title of the picker.

attributes.name: visible
attributes.description: Controls the visibility of the picker.
